intervention_catalogue.name: Help Programme
intervention_catalogue.long_description:
Help is an early intervention domestic abuse programme . 
 The priority of Help is to support the development and maintenance of healthy intimate relationships and to protect against the escalation of problematic behaviours and to do this it offers insight into the values, attitudes and skills which are necessary to develop and maintain healthy intimate relationships. It provides the opportunity for the man referred to reflect on his attitudes and behaviours within the relationship and to work towards positive change.

risk_consideration.cn_score_guide:
At least one of three OASys criteria to be satisfied:
- Score of 2 on item 11.3 aggressive behaviour
- “Yes” answer to thinking & behaviour being related to risk
of serious harm to self or others
- “Yes” answer to attitudes being related to risk of serious
harm to self or others
risk_consideration.ogrs_score_guide: If OVP not available, 25+ on OGRS3

special_educational_needs.exclusion_literacy_level_guide: Participants should be sufficiently literate (able to read and understand simple sentences

exclusion.remaining_license_community_order_guide: Check with Treatment Manager if less than 9 months
exclusion.alcohol_drug_problem_guide: Alcohol / drug problems need to be stable before attendance.
exclusion.mental_health_problem_guide: Those with mental health problems should only be excluded from the programme if the issues are acute and damage the individual’s ability to relate to others or concentrate
exclusion.other_preferred_method_guide: Must not be suitable for or not able to access an Accredited Programme
